FuncDef:
The redirect ds-domain command enables the device to redirect enterprise users in a DS domain to a specified BA classification domain.
The undo redirect ds-domain command restores the default configuration.
By default, the device is disabled from redirecting enterprise users in a DS domain to a specified BA classification domain.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a BA classification domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 48 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
ACK packets sent by the DHCP server carry specific Option information. If the device is configured to identify enterprise users and redirect them to a BA classification domain, run the redirect ds-domain command to specify the name of a BA classification domain. After the command is run, enterprise users are redirected to a specified BA classification domain, whereas the originally configured BA classification policy still takes effect for non-enterprise users.
Prerequisites
The specified BA classification domain has been configured in the system view.The dhcp option include redirect ds-domain enable command has been run in the system view.

Precautions
If the command is run for more than once, the latest configuration overwrites the previous one.If the command is run for a DS domain, do not delete the specified BA classification domain in the system view.The configuration takes effect only for new users.
